alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Knox; Loudon; Morgan; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 7:42PM CDT until August 03 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Morgan County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Loudon County in east Tennessee... Central Anderson County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Knox County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Blount County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Roane County in east Tennessee... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 842 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Louisville, or near Alcoa, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Clinton, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Farragut, Oliver Springs, Louisville and Rockford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 362 and 384. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 83 and 84. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Blount; Knox; Loudon; Morgan; Roane
